newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Century formally rejects Downer bid.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Century formally rejects Downer bid.

text.p: Australian drilling contractor Century Drilling Ltd formally rejected on Friday a takeover bid by Downer Group Australia Pty Ltd, a unit of Paul-Y-Construction Holdings Ltd.

"The offer is opportunistic and significantly undervalues Century...the offer price is significantly below the current market price...and provides no premium for control," Century said in its Part B statement to Downer's offer.
Downer is offering A$1.02 per Century share and values the group at A$55.46 million. At 1.00 p.m. (0200 GMT), Century shares were one cent down at A$1.18.

Century forecast in its part B statement that revenue is forecast to rise 36 percent to A$99.3 million for the year to June 30, 1997, while the annual net profit is expected to jump 100 percent to A$8.8 million in 1996/97.
